intro: Neolabatia sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flower labatia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically have five petals. Neolabatia sessiliflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in tropical plant ecology and taxonomy.
